title: Temperature excursion during crystallization
description: Temperature exceeded the specified range of 10°C by 3°C for approximately 15 minutes during the crystallization step. Root cause analysis indicates a faulty temperature controller sensor.

resolution.action_taken: Temperature controller sensor was recalibrated and verified. Batch quality was not impacted based on final product testing. Additional monitoring implemented for future batches.

title: Equipment calibration overdue
description: The hydrogenation reactor H2-Reactor was found to be 2 days past its scheduled calibration date during pre-use inspection.

resolution.action_taken: Equipment was immediately taken out of service and recalibrated by qualified technicians. Calibration records verified and equipment returned to service. Preventive maintenance schedule updated.

title: Impurity level out of specification
description: Related substance B detected at 0.25% which exceeds the specification limit of 0.15%. Investigation revealed potential cross-contamination from previous batch processing.

resolution.action_taken: Batch was rejected and disposed of according to waste disposal procedures. Equipment cleaning validation was enhanced and additional rinse cycles implemented. Personnel retrained on cleaning procedures.

title: Process time exceeded limit
description: The resolution step took 8 hours instead of the specified maximum of 6 hours due to slower than expected phase separation.

resolution.action_taken: Extended processing time was assessed and deemed acceptable based on temperature and agitation logs. No impact on product quality. Process parameters reviewed for optimization.

title: Material mix-up detected
description: Wrong lot of calcium acetate was initially dispensed for salt formation step. Error was caught during pre-use verification by production operator.

title: Power outage during drying step
description: Unexpected power outage occurred during vacuum drying operation lasting 45 minutes. Emergency backup power maintained critical parameters.

resolution.action_taken: Drying cycle was extended by 2 hours to compensate for the interruption. Final moisture content testing confirmed specification compliance. Backup power system performance reviewed and validated.

title: Containment breach in HPAPI processing
description: Minor breach detected in isolator glove during micronization step. Immediate containment procedures were followed and area was decontaminated.

title: Analytical method failure
description: UHPLC system malfunction during related substances testing resulted in invalid results. System diagnostics revealed column blockage issue.
